    <us-gaap:BusinessDescriptionAndBasisOfPresentationTextBlock 
contextRef="From2016-01-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 1 &amp;#150; ORGANIZATION
AND DESCRIPTION OF OPERATIONS&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 
8pt"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Description of Business&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 
8pt"&gt;Legend Oil and Gas, Ltd.&#13;(the &amp;#147;Company&amp;#148; or 
&amp;#147;Legend&amp;#148;) is a crude oil hauling and trucking company with 
principal operations in&#13;the Bakken region of North Dakota and the Permian 
Basin in Texas. These crude oil hauling operations commenced through 
our&#13;acquisition of Black Diamond Energy Holdings, LLC 
(&amp;#147;Maxxon&amp;#148;) on April&amp;#160;3,&amp;#160;2015. Our business 
focus is to&#13;expand our crude oil hauling operations into other basins within
Colorado, Texas and Oklahoma. Our operations are managed&#13;by employees based 
principally in North Dakota and Denver, Colorado, with the Company&amp;#146;s 
contract CEO and CFO based&#13;out of Georgia.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 
8pt"&gt;Further, through October&amp;#160;27,&amp;#160;2015, we were&#13;also an
oil and gas exploration, development and production company; this business was 
to acquire producing and non-producing oil&#13;and gas interests and develop oil
and gas properties that we owned or in which we had a leasehold interest. Our 
oil and gas property&#13;interests were located in the United States (Kansas and
Oklahoma). On October 27, 2015, we sold our oil and gas exploration 
operations&#13;and we have presented those operations as discontinued 
operations.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:BusinessDescriptionAndBasisOfPresentationTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock contextRef="From2016-01-
01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 2 &amp;#150; SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT
ACCOUNTING&#13;POLICIES&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 
8pt"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Principles of Consolidation&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;The 
condensed consolidated financial statements&#13;at and for the three and six 
month periods ended June 30, 2016 include the accounts of the Company, and 
our&#13;wholly-owned subsidiary, Black Diamond Energy Holdings, LLC and its 
wholly-owned subsidiaries Maxxon Energy, LLC and Treeline&#13;Diesel Center, 
LLC. Intercompany transactions and balances have been eliminated in 
consolidation.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Basis of 
Presentation&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In the opinion of management, the 
accompanying condensed consolidated&#13;financial statements include all 
adjustments necessary to present fairly the financial position, results of 
operations and cash&#13;flows of the Company. These adjustments are of a normal,
recurring nature. However, the financial statements do not include all&#13;of 
the disclosures normally required by accounting principles generally accepted in
the United States of America or those normally&#13;made in the 
Company&amp;#146;s Annual Report on Form 10-K. Please refer to the 
Company&amp;#146;s Annual Report on Form 10-K for the&#13;year ended December 
31, 2015 for such disclosures. The condensed consolidated balance sheet as of 
December 31, 2015 was derived&#13;from the audited consolidated balance sheet as
of that date. The results of operations for interim periods are not 
necessarily&#13;indicative of the results to be expected for the full year. The 
information included in this Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q should&#13;be read in
conjunction with Management&amp;#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial 
Condition and Results of Operations and the&#13;consolidated financial 
statements and notes thereto, included in the Company&amp;#146;s 2015 Annual 
Report on Form 10-K.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 
8pt"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Reclassifications&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 
8pt"&gt;Certain information from the three and six months&#13;ended June 30, 
2015, and at December 31, 2015, have been reclassified to conform with the 
current period&amp;#146;s presentation&#13;in connection with our discontinued 
operations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In the Company&amp;#146;s statement of cash flows included 
in Form&#13;10-Q for the three months ended March 31, 2016 and 2015, the Company
classified its cash flows attributable to the repayment of&#13;notes payable as 
&amp;#147;net cash used in financing activities &amp;#150; discontinued 
operations&amp;#148; as a result of its decision&#13;to dispose of its oil and 
gas exploration segment as described in Note 1. During the three months ended 
June 30, 2016, management&#13;reevaluated the nature of the Company&amp;#146;s 
notes payable and determined that such note payable is attributable to 
continuing&#13;activities.&amp;#160; Accordingly, the condensed consolidated 
statements of cash flows for the six months ended June 30, 2016 and 
2015&#13;present the cash flow activity relating to the Company&amp;#146;s notes
payable as &amp;#147;net cash used in financing activities 
&amp;#150;&#13;continuing operations&amp;#148;.&amp;#160; The following table 
presents amounts which were included in the condensed consolidated 
statements&#13;of cash flows included in Form 10-Q for the three months ended 
March 31, 2016 and 2015 which have been reclassified to conform&#13;to the 
current presentation.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;
&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;

New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 8pt 
0"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Assets held for sale - discontinued operations 
&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;We own a drilling rig which we have classified as 
an&#13;asset held for sale, which is part of our discontinued operations. Long-
lived assets that are expected to be recovered through a sale&#13;or disposition
are classified as held for sale. Assets classified as held for sale are 
evaluated for impairment using the&#13;lower of fair value less disposal costs 
and carrying value. Assets held for sale are not depreciated. During the three 
and&#13;six months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015, no impairment loss was 
recorded.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 8pt
0"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Net Loss Per Common Share&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;The 
computation of basic net loss per&#13;common share is based on the weighted 
average number of shares that were outstanding during the period, 
including&#13;contingently
 redeemable common stock. The computation of diluted net loss per common share 
is based on the weighted average&#13;number of shares used in the basic net loss
per share calculation plus the number of common shares that would be 
issued&#13;assuming the exercise of all potentially dilutive common shares 
outstanding. All potentially dilutive shares or&#13;convertible instruments 
outstanding for the six month periods June 30, 2016 and 2015 were anti-dilutive.
Potentially dilutive&#13;common shares include convertible preferred stock and 
convertible debentures.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding="0" 
cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%; font: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13; 
&lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="font-weight: bold; padding-bottom: 
1pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="3" style="font-weight: 
bold; text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid"&gt;June 30,&lt;br 
/&gt; 2016&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="font-weight: bold; padding-bottom: 
1pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="3" style="font-weight: 
bold; text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid"&gt;June 30,&lt;br 
/&gt; 2015&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: 
bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;Potentially dilutive of common stock 
equivalents:&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td

New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Recently Issued 
Accounting&#13;Pronouncements&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt; background-color: 
white"&gt;From time to time, new accounting&#13;pronouncements are issued by the
Financial Accounting Standards Board or FASB or other standard setting bodies 
and adopted by the&#13;Company as of the specified effective date. Unless 
otherwise discussed below, the Company believes that the impact of 
recently&#13;issued standards that are not yet effective will not have a 
material impact on its financial position or results of operations&#13;upon 
adoption.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: normal 10pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt; background-color: white"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: normal 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;In&#13;March, 2016, 
FASB issued accounting standards update (ASU) 2016-09, &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Compensation&#13;-
Stock Compensation: Improvements to Employee Share-Based Payment 
Accounting&lt;/i&gt;&lt;font style="font-style: normal"&gt;,&#13;which relates 
to the accounting for employee share-based payments. The guidance in this update
addresses several aspects of&#13;the accounting for share-based payments, 
including income tax consequences, classification of awards as either 
equity&#13;or liabilities and classification on the statement of cash flows. The
new standard is effective for the Company beginning&#13;on January 1, 2017. The 
Company is evaluating the effect that ASU 2016-09 will have on its consolidated 
financial statements&#13;and related 
disclosures.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:ConsolidationPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2016-01-01to2016-06-
30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 
8pt"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Principles of Consolidation&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;The 
condensed consolidated financial statements&#13;at and for the three and six 
month periods ended June 30, 2016 include the accounts of the Company, and 
our&#13;wholly-owned subsidiary, Black Diamond Energy Holdings, LLC and its 
wholly-owned subsidiaries Maxxon Energy, LLC and Treeline&#13;Diesel Center, 
LLC. Intercompany transactions and balances have been eliminated in 
consolidation.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:ConsolidationPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:BasisOfAccountingPolicyPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2016-01-
01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Basis of 
Presentation&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In the opinion of management, the 
accompanying condensed consolidated&#13;financial statements include all 
adjustments necessary to present fairly the financial position, results of 
operations and cash&#13;flows of the Company. These adjustments are of a normal,
recurring nature. However, the financial statements do not include all&#13;of 
the disclosures normally required by accounting principles generally accepted in
the United States of America or those normally&#13;made in the 
Company&amp;#146;s Annual Report on Form 10-K. Please refer to the 
Company&amp;#146;s Annual Report on Form 10-K for the&#13;year ended December 
31, 2015 for such disclosures. The condensed consolidated balance sheet as of 
December 31, 2015 was derived&#13;from the audited consolidated balance sheet as
of that date. The results of operations for interim periods are not 
necessarily&#13;indicative of the results to be expected for the full year. The 
information included in this Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q should&#13;be read in
conjunction with Management&amp;#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial 
Condition and Results of Operations and the&#13;consolidated financial 
statements and notes thereto, included in the Company&amp;#146;s 2015 Annual 
Report on Form 10-K.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:BasisOfAccountingPolicyPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:PriorPeriodReclassificationAdjustmentDescription 
contextRef="From2016-01-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 
8pt"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Reclassifications&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 
8pt"&gt;Certain information from the three and six months&#13;ended June 30, 
2015, and at December 31, 2015, have been reclassified to conform with the 
current period&amp;#146;s presentation&#13;in connection with our discontinued 
operations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In the Company&amp;#146;s statement of cash flows included 
in Form&#13;10-Q for the three months ended March 31, 2016 and 2015, the Company
classified its cash flows attributable to the repayment of&#13;notes payable as 
&amp;#147;net cash used in financing activities &amp;#150; discontinued 
operations&amp;#148; as a result of its decision&#13;to dispose of its oil and 
gas exploration segment as described in Note 1. During the three months ended 
June 30, 2016, management&#13;reevaluated the nature of the Company&amp;#146;s 
notes payable and determined that such note payable is attributable to 
continuing&#13;activities.&amp;#160; Accordingly, the condensed consolidated 
statements of cash flows for the six months ended June 30, 2016 and 
2015&#13;present the cash flow activity relating to the Company&amp;#146;s notes
payable as &amp;#147;net cash used in financing activities
&amp;#150;&#13;continuing operations&amp;#148;.&amp;#160; The following table 
presents amounts which were included in the condensed consolidated 
statements&#13;of cash flows included in Form 10-Q for the three months ended 
March 31, 2016 and 2015 which have been reclassified to conform&#13;to the 
current presentation.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New

    <us-gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2016-01-01to2016-
06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 8pt
0"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Net Loss Per Common Share&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;The 
computation of basic net loss per&#13;common share is based on the weighted 
average number of shares that were outstanding during the period, 
including&#13;contingently redeemable common stock. The computation of diluted 
net loss per common share is based on the weighted average&#13;number of shares 
used in the basic net loss per share calculation plus the number of common 
shares that would be issued&#13;assuming the exercise of all potentially 
dilutive common shares outstanding. All potentially dilutive shares 
or&#13;convertible instruments outstanding for the six month periods June 30, 
2016 and 2015 were anti-dilutive. Potentially dilutive&#13;common shares include
convertible preferred stock and convertible 
debentures.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding="0" 
cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%; font: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;

    <us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock 
contextRef="From2016-01-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New

Issued Accounting&#13;Pronouncements&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt; 
background-color: white"&gt;From time to time, new accounting&#13;pronouncements
are issued by the Financial Accounting Standards Board or FASB or other standard
setting bodies and adopted by the&#13;Company as of the specified effective 
date. Unless otherwise discussed below, the Company believes that the impact of 
recently&#13;issued standards that are not yet effective will not have a 
material impact on its financial position or results of operations&#13;upon 
adoption.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: normal 10pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt; background-color: white"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: normal 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;In&#13;March, 2016, 
FASB issued accounting standards update (ASU) 2016-09, &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Compensation&#13;- 
Stock Compensation: Improvements to Employee Share-Based Payment
Accounting&lt;/i&gt;&lt;font style="font-style: normal"&gt;,&#13;which relates 
to the accounting for employee share-based payments. The guidance in this update
addresses several aspects of&#13;the accounting for share-based payments, 
including income tax consequences, classification of awards as either 
equity&#13;or liabilities and classification on the statement of cash flows. The
new standard is effective for the Company beginning&#13;on January 1, 2017. The 
Company is evaluating the effect that ASU 2016-09 will have on its consolidated 
financial statements&#13;and related 
disclosures.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:DiscontinuedOperationsPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2016-01-
01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 8pt 0"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Assets held for sale - discontinued operations 
&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;We own a drilling rig which we have classified as 
an&#13;asset held for sale, which is part of our discontinued operations. Long-
lived assets that are expected to be recovered through a sale&#13;or disposition
are classified as held for sale. Assets classified as held for sale are 
evaluated for impairment using the&#13;lower of fair value less disposal costs 
and carrying value. Assets held for sale are not depreciated. During the three 
and&#13;six months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015, no impairment loss was 
recorded.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:DiscontinuedOperationsPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:SubstantialDoubtAboutGoingConcernTextBlock contextRef="From2016-01-
01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 3 &amp;#150; GOING 
CONCERN&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;The accompanying condensed 
consolidated&#13;financial statements have been prepared on a going concern 
basis, which contemplates the realization of assets and&#13;satisfaction of 
liabilities in the normal course of business. The Company has incurred 
significant losses from continuing&#13;operations of approximately $2 million 
for the six months ended June 30,&amp;#160;2016 and had negative working capital
of&#13;approximately $700 thousand at June 30,&amp;#160;2016. Additionally, the 
Company is dependent on a small number of customers in&#13;obtaining its revenue
goals. Further, obtaining additional debt and/or equity financing to roll-out 
and scale its planned&#13;principal business operations may be limited due our 
losses from operations. These factors raise substantial doubt about 
the&#13;Company&amp;#146;s ability to continue as a going 
concern.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;Management&amp;#146;s plans in regard to these
matters&#13;consist principally of seeking additional debt and/or equity 
financing combined with restructuring its current debt obligations,&#13;and 
expected cash flows from our crude oil hauling company and assets that it may 
acquire. There can be no assurance that the&#13;Company&amp;#146;s efforts will 
be successful. The financial statements do not include any adjustments that may 
result from the outcome&#13;of this uncertainty.&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:SubstantialDoubtAboutGoingConcernTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:PropertyPlantAndEquipmentDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2016-

text-indent: -5.4pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 8pt 0"&gt;The drilling rig, in the amount of 
$398,680 (net&#13;of accumulated depreciation of $66,320) was previously 
included in property and equipment, and has been reclassified to&#13;assets held
for sale - discontinued operations, as the Company has ceased all drilling 
operations. During the third quarter&#13;2015, the Company impaired the value of
their Treeline Diesel Center, LLC subsidiary assets with a carrying value of 
$224,835&#13;(net of accumulated depreciation of 
$33,108).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 8pt 0"&gt;In February the Company exchanged vehicles 
with&#13;a carrying value of $184,439 for new vehicles with a purchase price of 
$198,210. In addition, the vehicles traded were&#13;financed with an outstanding
principal balance of $166,614 owed at the date of the exchange, which was 
extinguished in full.&#13;The Company assumed liabilities for the new vehicles 
of $211,658. Accordingly, the Company recorded a loss on the disposition&#13;of 
the vehicles of $31,272 during the three and six months ended June 30, 
2016.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 8pt 0"&gt;The company recorded depreciation expense for the six 
months ended June 30, 2016&#13;and 2015 of $377,255 and $190,410, 
respectively.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:PropertyPlantAndEquipmentDisclosureTextBlock>

    <us-gaap:AssetRetirementObligationDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2016-
01-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif;
margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 6&amp;#160;&amp;#150; LIABILITIES 
OF&#13;DISCONTINUED OPERATIONS &amp;#150; ASSET RETIREMENT 
OBLIGATION&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;The asset retirement obligation 
recorded as of&#13;both June 30, 2016 and December 31, 2015 was related to the 
Van Pelt lease, a non-producing field and discontinued operation, that 
the&#13;Company acquired during 2015, and which the Company still owned as of 
June 30, 2016. &amp;#160;The asset retirement obligation at&#13;both June 30,
2016 and December 31, 2015 was $118,425 and $96,129, respectively, and has been 
included within liabilities&#13;of discontinued operations of the condensed 
consolidated statements of operations. The Company recorded $0 and $2,400&#13;in
accretion expense of the asset retirement obligation liability during the three 
months ended June 30, 2016 and&#13;2015, respectively. The Company recorded 
$22,296 and $4,785 in accretion expense of the asset retirement 
obligation&#13;liability during the six months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015, 
respectively.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:AssetRetirementObligationDisclosureTextBlock>

which our CEO is a principal, in the amount of $120,000, as a result&#13;of the 
bonus accrual under the NPE letter agreement for CEO services, which was paid 
out during the six months ended June&#13;30, 2016.&lt;/p&gt;</us-

    <logl:ConvertibleDebtRelatedPartyTextBlock contextRef="From2016-01-01to2016-
06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0
8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 8 &amp;#150; &lt;font style="text-transform: 
uppercase"&gt;Convertible&#13;debt &amp;#150; related 
party&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt"&gt;On October 22,&#13;2015, the Company consummated a Securities Purchase 
Agreement with Hillair Capital Investments, LP 
(&amp;#147;Hillair&amp;#148;)&#13;pursuant to which it issued an Original Issue 
Discount Senior Secured Convertible Debenture in the aggregate amount 
of&#13;$654,000, payable in full on March 1, 2017. The debenture was convertible
into 21,800,000 shares of common stock at a&#13;conversion price of $0.03 per 
share. After taking into account the original issue discount, legal and 
diligence fees of&#13;$104,000 reimbursed to Hillair, the net proceeds received 
by the Company were $550,000.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;On January 29, 
2016, the Company and Hillair amended the Securities&#13;Purchase Agreement (the
&amp;#147;Amended SPA&amp;#148;) to increase the aggregate amount available to 
the Company. The Amended SPA increased&#13;the amount from $654,000 to 
$1,439,400. As a result, the Company received $630,000 in new proceeds, net of 
original issue discount,&#13;legal and diligence fees of $155,400 which were 
recorded as a debt discount. The debenture is convertible into 381,313,333 
shares&#13;of common stock at a conversion price of $0.03 per share. The Amended
SPA also extended the maturity date to March 1, 2018. All&#13;other terms of the
debenture remain the same.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;On March 25, 2016, we entered
into a convertible debenture&#13;with Hillair totaling $410,788, due and 
payable&amp;#160;on March 1, 2018. This debenture is convertible 
into&amp;#160;13,692,933 of our&#13;common shares at $0.03 per share. We 
received net proceeds of $360,000, net of original issue discount, legal and 
diligence fees,&#13;which were recorded as a debt discount within the 
convertible debt - related party line of the accompanying condensed 
consolidated&#13;balance sheet.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;On April 6, 2016,
we entered into a convertible debenture&#13;with Hillair totaling $1,159,206, 
due and payable&amp;#160;on March 1, 2018. This debenture is convertible 
into&amp;#160;38,340,200 of&#13;our common shares at $0.03 per share. We 
received net proceeds of $1,000,000, net of original issue discount, legal and 
diligence&#13;fees, which were recorded as a debt discount within the 
convertible debt - related party line of the accompanying condensed 
consolidated&#13;balance sheet.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;On May 27, 2016, we entered&#13;into a convertible 
debenture with Hillair totaling $460,082, due and payable&amp;#160;on March 1, 
2018. This debenture is convertible&#13;into&amp;#160;15,336,080 of our common
shares at $0.03 per share. We received net proceeds of $400,000, net of original
issue discount,&#13;legal and diligence fees, which were recorded as a debt 
discount within the convertible debt - related party line of the 
accompanying&#13;condensed consolidated balance sheet.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 
8pt"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;The total debt discount and 
deferred financing costs&#13;for the convertible debentures amount to $450,611 
and $89,323 (net of accumulated amortization of $78,865 and $14,677) as 
of&#13;June 30, 2016 and December 31, 2015, respectively. The Company amortized 
to interest expense, the debt discounts and deferred&#13;financing costs 
associated with its convertible debentures in the amount of $48,626 and $0 for 
the three months ended June&#13;30, 2016 and 2015, respectively, and $64,188 and
$0 for the six months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015, 
respectively.&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</logl:ConvertibleDebtRelatedPartyTextBlock>

June 30, 2016, we paid $1,000,000 against this note as part of our 
agreement&#13;    with Sher. The remaining amount outstanding on the note as of

respectively. The     restructuring fee     of     $219,997 (net of accumulated 
amortization of $30,003) is &#13;    being     amortized     to     interest    
expense       through     the term of     the     agreement.     The note is 
due&#13;    on     April 3,          2018. The        note     will     remain  
collateralized     by     the      same   &#13;    collateral assets (tractors 
and trailers) as         the     original     promissory     note     to     
Sher. Those assets&#13;    have a net book value of $1,854,903 (net of 
accumulated depreciation of $535,097).&lt;/font&gt;

width: 68%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif"&gt;On&#13;    April 5, 2016, the Company entered into an agreement with 
Sher that restructured the existing secured promissory note&#13;    ($2,854,000)
plus accrued interest ($142,700) and a $250,000 restructuring fee, (the 
&amp;#147;Restructuring&amp;#148;), with an&#13;    amended and restated note 
totaling $3,246,700. This note accrues interest at 15% per annum, with all 
principal and interest&#13;    due upon maturity. During the six months ended 
June 30, 2016, we paid $1,000,000 against this note as part of our 
agreement&#13;    with Sher. The remaining amount outstanding on the note as of 
June 30, 2016 and December 31, 2015 was $2,246,700 and&#13;    $2,854,000, 
respectively. The     restructuring fee     of     $219,997 (net of accumulated 
amortization of $30,003) is &#13;    being     amortized     to     interest    
expense       through     the term of     the     agreement.     The note is 
due&#13;    on     April 3,          2018. The        note     will     remain  
collateralized     by     the      same   &#13;    collateral assets (tractors 
and trailers) as         the     original     promissory     note     to     
Sher. Those assets&#13;    have a net book value of $1,854,903 (net of 
accumulated depreciation of $535,097).&lt;/font&gt;

with interest at 3.99% and is due on April 1, 2021. &lt;/font&gt;The new note is
secured by the new&#13;    vehicle acquired with a net book value of $111,051 
(net of accumulated depreciation of $7,890).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;

services&#13;rendered on or before November 30, 2012. This claim has been 
satisfactorily resolved between the parties, and Legend is remitting&#13;$2,500 
per month in settlement of this claim, until such balance is fully repaid. 
During the six months ended June 30, 2016, the&#13;Company made principal 
payments of $15,000 and capitalized $1,365 of interest expense to the principal 
balance.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="vertical-align: bottom;

    <us-gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2016-01-
01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0 0 8pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 10 
&amp;#150;&#13;STOCKHOLDERS&amp;#146; EQUITY 
(DEFICIT)&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;On December 21, 2015, the 
Company&#13;obtained stockholder approval to amend the Company&amp;#146;s 
Articles of Incorporation to effect an increase in the amount of&#13;authorized 
shares of from 1,100,000,000 to 5,000,000,000. The Company increased the number 
of authorized shares of common&#13;stock from 1 billion shares, with a par value
of $0.001, to 4.9 billion shares, with a par value of $0.001 and 100 
million&#13;shares designated as blank check preferred stock. As of June 30, 
2016 and December 31, 2015 the Company designated 600 shares&#13;and 9,643 
shares of its 100 million shares of blank check preferred stock as Series A 
Convertible Preferred and Series B&#13;Convertible Preferred, 
respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Convertible Preferred 
Stock&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;On October 22, 2015, the Company 
consummated&#13;a Securities Exchange Agreement with Hillair, its majority 
shareholder, pursuant to which it issued 9,643 shares of Series&#13;B 
Convertible Preferred Stock (the &amp;#147;Series B Preferred Shares&amp;#148;) 
in exchange for the cancellation of debentures&#13;held by Hillair with a total 
principal value of $9,642,546 and accrued interest of $182,430. The shares are 
convertible into&#13;327,499,200 shares of our common stock at $0.03 per 
share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;The Company had issued and&#13;outstanding 600 shares
of its Series A Convertible Preferred Stock. This convertible preferred stock 
has a 0% dividend rate. The&#13;shares of preferred stock are convertible into 
600 million shares of the Company&amp;#185;s common stock at $0.0001 per share, 
and&#13;have a non-dilution provision. The shares were converted to 600 million 
shares of common stock in May 2015.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Common Stock Issuances&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;In 
April 2015, the Company issued 90,817,356 shares&#13;of common stock to Albert 
Valentin as part of its purchase of Maxxon. The stock had a fair value of 
$526,741. The fair value of&#13;the common stock was determined using the 
closing price of the shares on the grant date.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;In 
December 2015, the Company issued 57,682,644 shares&#13;of common stock to 
Steven Wallace as part of its purchase of Maxxon. The stock had a fair value of 
$334,559. The fair value of&#13;the common stock was determined using the 
closing price of the shares on the grant date.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;On 
March 2, 2016, the Company issued common stock&#13;to an employee. A total of 6 
million shares were issued with a fair value of $10,800 using the closing market
price on the&#13;date of issuance.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:DisposalGroupsIncludingDiscontinuedOperationsDisclosureTextBlock

2015 were&#13;$280,255 and $302,551, respectively. The table below summarizes

    <us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock 
contextRef="From2016-01-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 12 &amp;#150; COMMITMENTS
AND CONTINGENCIES&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;The Company is not aware of 
any pending or threatened&#13;legal proceedings, nor is the Company aware of any
pending or threatened legal proceedings, affecting any current officer, 
director&#13;or control shareholder, or their 
affiliates.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;As part of its regular operations, the Company
may&#13;become party to various pending or threatened claims, lawsuits and 
administrative proceedings seeking damages or other remedies&#13;concerning 
its&amp;#146; commercial operations, products, employees and other matters. 
Although the Company can give no assurance&#13;about the outcome of these or any
other pending legal and administrative proceedings and the effect such outcomes 
may have on the&#13;Company, the Company believes that any ultimate liability 
resulting from the outcome of such proceedings, to the extent not 
otherwise&#13;provided for or covered by insurance, will not have a material 
adverse effect on the Company&amp;#146;s financial condition or results&#13;of 
operations.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;On February 15, 2016, the Company entered into a 
trailer&#13;lease agreement with Wallwork Truck Center. The Company leased 10 
trailers at a monthly rent of $17,335 for 48 months commencing&#13;on February 
12, 2016 and continuing until February 12, 2020.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;The 
Company leases office space on&#13;a month-to-month basis, with monthly rental 
payments due of approximately $2,200. The Company leases office space, 
a&#13;diesel repair shop, and employee housing under non-cancelable lease 
agreements. The leases provide that we pay taxes,&#13;insurance, utilities, and 
maintenance expenses related to the leased assets. During March 2016, we entered
into a&#13;restructured lease agreement with the property owner/landlord, where 
the facility lease has been restructured to a 60 month&#13;lease commencing 
April 1, 2016. &amp;#160;The restructured lease indicates that we will not pay 
any cash lease payments while we&#13;deplete our $120,000 security deposit held 
by the landlord, which is included in other assets on the accompanying 
balance&#13;sheets. The revised lease and its payment structure will be such 
that we will use the funds contained in the security deposit&#13;in the amount 
of $6,000 per month as rent expense (in lieu of cash payments) while WTI oil 
prices remain below $60.00 per&#13;barrel, for any 30 day period. When the price
of WTI oil goes above $60.00 per barrel but less than $80.00 per barrel for 
any&#13;30 day period, we will use the revised amount against our deposit of 
$7,500 per month. Upon the price of WTI oil being above&#13;the $80.00 per 
barrel level for a 30 day period, the Company&amp;#146;s rent payment will be 
$10,000 per month,&#13;the maximum rental payment under the restructured lease
agreement.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock contextRef="From2016-01-01to2016-06-
30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 
8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 13 &amp;#150; SUBSEQUENT 
EVENTS&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;The Company has evaluated events and 
transactions subsequent&#13;to June 30, 2016 and through the date these 
condensed consolidated financial statements were included in this Form 10-Q and 
filed&#13;with the SEC.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;On July 27, 2016, we entered into 
an&#13;agreement with Hillair  where to which it issued an Original 
Issue&#13;Discount Senior Convertible Debenture (the 
&amp;#147;Debenture&amp;#148;) to Hillair in the aggregate amount of 
$550,000,&#13;payable in full on March 1, 2018. The Debenture is unsecured and 
is convertible into up to 18,333,333 shares of Common Stock&#13;at a conversion 
price of $0.03 per share. After taking into account the original issue discount 
and legal and diligence fees&#13;of $75,000 reimbursed to the Purchaser, the net
proceeds received by the Company were 
$475,000.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;On July 26, 2016, we entered into an 
operating lease&#13;with a finance company for three tanker trailers. The lease 
is for 60 months and required a downpayment of $60,000. The 
aggregate&#13;monthly payment is approximately $6,000, for all three 
trailers.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"&gt;On July 5, 2016,&amp;#160;the Company entered 
into a convertible&#13;debenture with Hillair totaling in the aggregate amount 
of $330,000, payable in full on March 1, 2018. This debenture is 
convertible&#13;into up to 11,000,000 shares of our Common Stock at a conversion
price of $0.03 per share. We received net proceeds of $300,000,&#13;net of 
original issue discount, legal and diligence fees, which were recorded as 
deferred financing costs and an original issue&#13;discount.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock>
</xbrli:xbrl>
</XBRL>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>

historical data, it is the date up through which that historical data is

<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Sum of the carrying values as of the balance sheet date of
obligations incurred through that date and due within one year (or the operating
cycle, if longer), including liabilities incurred (and for which invoices have 
typically been received) and payable to vendors for goods and services received,
taxes, interest, rent and utilities, accrued salaries and bonuses, payroll taxes
and fringe benefits.</p></div>

<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Amount due from customers or clients, within one year of 
the balance sheet date (or the normal operating cycle, whichever is longer), for
goods or services (including trade receivables) that have been delivered or sold
in the normal course of business, reduced to the estimated net realizable fair
value by an allowance established by the entity of the amount it deems uncertain
of collection.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_AdditionalPaidInCapital">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Excess of issue price over par or stated value of the 
entity's capital stock and amounts received from other transactions involving 
the entity's stock or stockholders. Includes adjustments to additional paid in 
capital. Some examples of such adjustments include recording the issuance of 
debt with a beneficial conversion feature and certain tax consequences of equity
instruments awarded to employees. Use this element for the aggregate amount of 
additional paid-in capital associated with common and preferred stock. For 
additional paid-in capital associated with only common stock, use the element 
additional paid in capital, common stock. For additional paid-in capital 
associated with only preferred stock, use the element additional paid in 
capital, preferred stock.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name 
Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 210<br> -SubTopic 10<br> -Section 
S99<br> -Paragraph 1<br> -Subparagraph (SX 210.5-02(30)(a)(1))<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6877327&amp;loc=d3e13212-
122682<br></p></div>

Definition</a><div><p>Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date 
of all assets that are recognized. Assets are probable future economic benefits 
obtained or controlled by an entity as a result of past transactions or 
events.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_AssetsCurrent">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date 
of all assets that are expected to be realized in cash, sold, or consumed within
one year (or the normal operating cycle, if longer). Assets are probable future 
economic benefits obtained or controlled by an entity as a result of past 
transactions or events.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1:

http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6877327&amp;loc=d3e13212-

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-
gaap_CashAndCashEquivalentsAtCarryingValue">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with
banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the 
general characteristics of demand deposits. Also includes short-term, highly 
liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash 
and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in 
value because of changes in interest rates. Excludes cash and cash equivalents 
within disposal group and discontinued operation.</p></div>

Definition</a><div><p>Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date 
of all liabilities that are recognized. Liabilities are probable future 
sacrifices of economic benefits arising from present obligations of an entity to
transfer assets or provide services to other entities in the future.</p></div>

limited to, notes payable, bonds payable, debentures, mortgage loans and

<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Amount after unamortized (discount) premium and debt 
issuance costs of long-term debt classified as noncurrent and excluding amounts 
to be repaid within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer. Includes,
but not limited to, notes payable, bonds payable, debentures, mortgage loans and
commercial paper. Excludes capital lease obligations.</p></div>

<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
Details</a><div style="display: none;"><table border="0" cellpadding="0" 
cellspacing="0">

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_StockholdersEquity">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Total of all stockholders' equity (deficit) items, net of 
receivables from officers, directors, owners, and affiliates of the entity which
are attributable to the parent. The amount of the economic entity's 
stockholders' equity attributable to the parent excludes the amount of 
stockholders' equity which is allocable to that ownership interest in subsidiary
equity which is not attributable to the parent (noncontrolling interest, 
minority interest). This excludes temporary equity and is sometimes called 
permanent equity.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+

Definition</a><div><p>Total number of common shares of an entity that have been 
sold or granted to shareholders (includes common shares that were issued, 
repurchased and remain in the treasury). These shares represent capital invested
by the firm's shareholders and owners, and may be all or only a portion of the 
number of shares authorized. Shares issued include shares outstanding and shares
held in the treasury.</p></div>

style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_DeferredFinanceCostsNoncurrentGross">

onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Amount, before accumulated amortization, of debt issuance 
costs classified as noncurrent. Includes, but is not limited to, legal, 
accounting, underwriting, printing, and registration costs.</p></div>

Definition</a><div><p>Total number of nonredeemable preferred shares (or 
preferred stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer) issued to 
shareholders (includes related preferred shares that were issued, repurchased, 
and remain in the treasury). May be all or portion of the number of preferred 
shares authorized. Excludes preferred shares that are classified as 
debt.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_EarningsPerShareBasicAndDiluted">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>The amount of net income or loss for the period per each
share in instances when basic and diluted earnings per share are the same amount
and reported as a single line item on the face of the financial statements.  
Basic earnings per share is the amount of net income or loss for the period per 
each share of common stock or unit outstanding during the reporting period.  
Diluted earnings per share includes the amount of net income or loss for the 
period available to each share of common stock or common unit outstanding during
the reporting period and to each share or unit that would have been outstanding 
assuming the issuance of common shares or units for all dilutive potential 
common shares or units outstanding during the reporting period.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>No definition available.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
Details</a><div style="display: none;"><table border="0" cellpadding="0"

gaap_IncomeLossFromDiscontinuedOperationsNetOfTax">

<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Amount after tax of income (loss) from a discontinued 
operation including the portion attributable to the noncontrolling interest. 
Includes, but is not limited to, the income (loss) from operations during the 
phase-out period, gain (loss) on disposal, gain (loss) for reversal of write-
down (write-down) to fair value, less cost to sell, and adjustments to a prior 
period gain (loss) on disposal.</p></div>

interest expense.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-
gaap_CashAndCashEquivalentsAtCarryingValue">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with
banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the 
general characteristics of demand deposits. Also includes short-term, highly 
liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash 
and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in 
value because of changes in interest rates. Excludes cash and cash equivalents 
within disposal group and discontinued operation.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-
gaap_CashAndCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecrease">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Amount of increase (decrease) in cash and cash 
equivalents. Cash and cash equivalents are the amount of currency on hand as 
well as demand deposits with banks or financial institutions. Includes other 
kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits. Also
includes short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible
to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present 
insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. 
Includes effect from exchange rate changes.</p></div>

<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>The value of the stock converted in a noncash (or part 
noncash) transaction. Noncash is defined as transactions during a period that do
not result in cash receipts or cash payments in the period. "Part noncash" 
refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash
payments in the period.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_DepreciationDepletionAndAmortization">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>The aggregate expense recognized in the current period 
that allocates the cost of tangible assets, intangible assets, or depleting 
assets to periods that benefit from use of the assets.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1:

gaap_IncomeLossFromDiscontinuedOperationsNetOfTax">

<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Amount after tax of income (loss) from a discontinued 
operation including the portion attributable to the noncontrolling interest. 
Includes, but is not limited to, the income (loss) from operations during the 
phase-out period, gain (loss) on disposal, gain (loss) for reversal of write-
down (write-down) to fair value, less cost to sell, and adjustments to a prior 
period gain (loss) on disposal.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData"

gaap_NetCashProvidedByUsedInFinancingActivities">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Amount of cash inflow (outflow) from financing activities,
including discontinued operations. Financing activity cash flows include 
obtaining resources from owners and providing them with a return on, and a 
return of, their investment; borrowing money and repaying amounts borrowed, or 
settling the obligation; and obtaining and paying for other resources obtained 
from creditors on long-term credit.</p></div>

http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=51831270<br><br>Reference 7:

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData"

<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>The aggregate amount of noncash, equity-based employee 
remuneration. This may include the value of stock or unit options, amortization 
of restricted stock or units, and adjustment for officers' compensation. As 
noncash, this element is an add back when calculating net cash generated by 
operating activities using the indirect method.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1:

<span style="display: none;">v3.5.0.2</span><table class="report" border="0" 
cellspacing="2" id="idp6761391232">
<tr>
<th class="tl" colspan="1" rowspan="2"><div style="width: 
200px;"><strong>ORGANIZATION AND DESCRIPTION OF 
OPERATIONS<br></strong></div></th>
<th class="th" colspan="1">6 Months Ended</th>
</tr>
<tr><th class="th"><div>Jun. 30, 2016</div></th></tr>
<tr class="re">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-
gaap_OrganizationConsolidationAndPresentationOfFinancialStatementsAbstract', 
window );"><strong>Organization, Consolidation and Presentation of Financial 
Statements [Abstract]</strong></a></td>
<td class="text">&#160;<span></span>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="ro">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-
gaap_BusinessDescriptionAndBasisOfPresentationTextBlock', 
window );">ORGANIZATION AND DESCRIPTION OF OPERATIONS</a></td>
<td class="text"><p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0 0 8pt"><b>NOTE 1 &#150; ORGANIZATION AND DESCRIPTION OF 
OPERATIONS</b></p>
<p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 
8pt"><i>Description of Business</i></p>
<p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 
8pt">Legend Oil and Gas, Ltd.
(the &#147;Company&#148; or &#147;Legend&#148;) is a crude oil hauling and 
trucking company with principal operations in
the Bakken region of North Dakota and the Permian Basin in Texas. These crude 
oil hauling operations commenced through our
acquisition of Black Diamond Energy Holdings, LLC (&#147;Maxxon&#148;) on 
April&#160;3,&#160;2015. Our business focus is to
expand our crude oil hauling operations into other basins within Colorado, Texas
and Oklahoma. Our operations are managed
by employees based principally in North Dakota and Denver, Colorado, with the 
Company&#146;s contract CEO and CFO based
out of Georgia.</p>
<p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 
8pt">Further, through October&#160;27,&#160;2015, we were
also an oil and gas exploration, development and production company; this 
business was to acquire producing and non-producing oil
and gas interests and develop oil and gas properties that we owned or in which 
we had a leasehold interest. Our oil and gas property
interests were located in the United States (Kansas and Oklahoma). On October 
27, 2015, we sold our oil and gas exploration operations
and we have presented those operations as discontinued
operations.</p><span></span>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<div style="display: none;">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-
gaap_BusinessDescriptionAndBasisOfPresentationTextBlock">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>The entire disclosure for the business description and 
basis of presentation concepts.  Business description describes the nature and 
type of organization including but not limited to organizational structure as 
may be applicable to holding companies, parent and subsidiary relationships, 
business divisions, business units, business segments, affiliates and 
information about significant ownership of the reporting entity.  Basis of 
presentation describes the underlying basis used to prepare the financial 
statements (for example, US Generally Accepted Accounting Principles, Other 
Comprehensive Basis of Accounting, IFRS).</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>No definition available.</p></div>

<span style="display: none;">v3.5.0.2</span><table class="report" border="0" 
cellspacing="2" id="idp6780066688">
<tr>
<th class="tl" colspan="1" rowspan="2"><div style="width: 
200px;"><strong>SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING 
POLICIES<br></strong></div></th>
<th class="th" colspan="1">6 Months Ended</th>
</tr>
<tr><th class="th"><div>Jun. 30, 2016</div></th></tr>
<tr class="re">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-
gaap_AccountingPoliciesAbstract', window );"><strong>Accounting Policies 
[Abstract]</strong></a></td>
<td class="text">&#160;<span></span>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="ro">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-
gaap_SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock', window );">SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT 
ACCOUNTING POLICIES</a></td>
<td class="text"><p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0 0 8pt"><b>NOTE 2 &#150; SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING
POLICIES</b></p>
<p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 
8pt"><i>Principles of Consolidation</i></p>
<p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt">The 
condensed consolidated financial statements
at and for the three and six month periods ended June 30, 2016 include the 
accounts of the Company, and our
wholly-owned subsidiary, Black Diamond Energy Holdings, LLC and its wholly-owned
subsidiaries Maxxon Energy, LLC and Treeline
Diesel Center, LLC. Intercompany transactions and balances have been eliminated 
in consolidation.</p>
<p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 
8pt"><i>Basis of Presentation</i></p>
<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">In the opinion of
management, the accompanying condensed consolidated
financial statements include all adjustments necessary to present fairly the 
financial position, results of operations and cash
flows of the Company. These adjustments are of a normal, recurring nature. 
However, the financial statements do not include all
of the disclosures normally required by accounting principles generally accepted
in the United States of America or those normally
made in the Company&#146;s Annual Report on Form 10-K. Please refer to the 
Company&#146;s Annual Report on Form 10-K for the
year ended December 31, 2015 for such disclosures. The condensed consolidated 
balance sheet as of December 31, 2015 was derived
from the audited consolidated balance sheet as of that date. The results of 
operations for interim periods are not necessarily
indicative of the results to be expected for the full year. The information 
included in this Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q should
be read in conjunction with Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of 
Financial Condition and Results of Operations and the
consolidated financial statements and notes thereto, included in the 
Company&#146;s 2015 Annual Report on Form 10-K.</p>
<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 
8pt"><i>Reclassifications</i></p>
<p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 
8pt">Certain information from the three and six months
ended June 30, 2015, and at December 31, 2015, have been reclassified to conform
with the current period&#146;s presentation
in connection with our discontinued operations.</p>
<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">In the 
Company&#146;s statement of cash flows included in Form
10-Q for the three months ended March 31, 2016 and 2015, the Company classified 
its cash flows attributable to the repayment of
notes payable as &#147;net cash used in financing activities &#150; discontinued
operations&#148; as a result of its decision
to dispose of its oil and gas exploration segment as described in Note 1. During
the three months ended June 30, 2016, management
reevaluated the nature of the Company&#146;s notes payable and determined that 
such note payable is attributable to continuing
activities.&#160; Accordingly, the condensed consolidated statements of cash 
flows for the six months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015
present the cash flow activity relating to the Company&#146;s notes payable as 
&#147;net cash used in financing activities &#150;
continuing operations&#148;.&#160; The following table presents amounts which 
were included in the condensed consolidated statements
of cash flows included in Form 10-Q for the three months ended March 31, 2016 
and 2015 which have been reclassified to conform
to the current presentation.</p>
<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#1
60;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160
;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</p>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse: collapse; width: 
100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
<tr style="vertical-align: bottom">
    <td style="font-size: 12pt">&#160;</td><td>&#160;</td>
    <td colspan="3" style="text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt 
solid"><b>As Originally Stated</b></td><td>&#160;</td>
    <td colspan="3" style="text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt 
solid"><b>As Restated</b></td></tr>
<tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204,238,255)">
    <td style="width: 56%; text-align: left; padding-left: 4pt">Proceeds from

    <td style="width: 1%; text-align: left">$</td><td style="width: 12%; text-

left">&#160;</td></tr>

    <td style="text-align: left; padding-left: 4pt">Payments on notes

    <td style="text-align: left">&#160;</td><td style="text-align:

    <td style="text-align: left">&#160;</td><td style="text-align:

    <td style="text-align: left; padding-left: 4pt">Net cash flows provided by

    <td style="text-align: left">&#160;</td><td style="text-align:

    <td style="text-align: left">&#160;</td><td style="text-align:

<tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White">
    <td style="text-align: left; padding-left: 4pt">Net cash flows provided by 
financing activities &#150; discontinued operations</td><td>&#160;</td>
    <td style="text-align: left">&#160;</td><td style="text-align: 
right">(449,044</td><td style="text-align: left">)</td><td style="font-size: 
12pt">&#160;</td>
    <td style="font-size: 12pt; text-align: left">&#160;</td><td style="font-
size: 12pt; text-align: right">&#160;</td><td style="font-size: 12pt; text-
align: left">&#160;</td></tr>
</table>
<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"></p>
<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"></p>
<p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt"></p>
<p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 8pt 
0"><i>Assets held for sale - discontinued operations </i></p>
<p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">We own a 
drilling rig which we have classified as an
asset held for sale, which is part of our discontinued operations. Long-lived 
assets that are expected to be recovered through a sale
or disposition are classified as held for sale. Assets classified as held for 
sale are evaluated for impairment using the
lower of fair value less disposal costs and carrying value. Assets held for sale
are not depreciated. During the three and
six months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015, no impairment loss was recorded.</p>
<p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 
8pt"><i></i></p>
<p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 8pt 0"><i>Net
Loss Per Common Share</i></p>
<p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt">The 
computation of basic net loss per
common share is based on the weighted average number of shares that were 
outstanding during the period, including
contingently redeemable common stock. The computation of diluted net loss per 
common share is based on the weighted average
number of shares used in the basic net loss per share calculation plus the 
number of common shares that would be issued
assuming the exercise of all potentially dilutive common shares outstanding. All
potentially dilutive shares or
convertible instruments outstanding for the six month periods June 30, 2016 and 
2015 were anti-dilutive. Potentially dilutive
common shares include convertible preferred stock and convertible 
debentures.</p>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse: collapse; width: 
100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
<tr style="vertical-align: bottom">
    <td>&#160;</td><td style="font-weight: bold; padding-bottom: 
1pt">&#160;</td>
    <td colspan="3" style="font-weight: bold; text-align: center; border-bottom:
Black 1pt solid">June 30,<br /> 2016</td><td style="font-weight: bold; padding-
bottom: 1pt">&#160;</td>
    <td colspan="3" style="font-weight: bold; text-align: center; border-bottom:
Black 1pt solid">June 30,<br /> 2015</td></tr>
<tr style="vertical-align: bottom">
    <td>Potentially dilutive of common stock equivalents:</td><td>&#160;</td>
    <td colspan="3">&#160;</td><td>&#160;</td>
    <td colspan="3">&#160;</td></tr>
<tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204,238,255)">
    <td style="width: 62%; text-align: left">Preferred stock</td><td 
style="width: 8%">&#160;</td>
    <td style="width: 1%; text-align: left">&#160;</td><td style="width: 12%; 
text-align: right">604,155,998</td><td style="width: 1%; text-align:
left">&#160;</td><td style="width: 2%">&#160;</td>
    <td style="width: 1%; text-align: left">&#160;</td><td style="width: 12%; 
text-align: right">&#151;&#160;&#160;</td><td style="width: 1%; text-align: 
left">&#160;</td></tr>

    <td style="text-align: left">Convertible Debt</td><td>&#160;</td>
    <td style="text-align: left">&#160;</td><td style="text-align: right"><font

    <td style="text-align: left">&#160;</td><td style="text-align:

</table>
<p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 5.4pt; 
text-indent: -5.4pt">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt; 
text-align: justify"><i>Recently Issued Accounting
Pronouncements</i></p>
<p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt; 
background-color: white">From time to time, new accounting
pronouncements are issued by the Financial Accounting Standards Board or FASB or
other standard setting bodies and adopted by the
Company as of the specified effective date. Unless otherwise discussed below, 
the Company believes that the impact of recently
issued standards that are not yet effective will not have a material impact on 
its financial position or results of operations
upon adoption.</p>
<p style="font: normal 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 
8pt; background-color: white"><font style="font: normal 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif">In
March, 2016, FASB issued accounting standards update (ASU) 2016-09, </font><font
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><i>Compensation
- Stock Compensation: Improvements to Employee Share-Based Payment 
Accounting</i><font style="font-style: normal">,
which relates to the accounting for employee share-based payments. The guidance 
in this update addresses several aspects of
the accounting for share-based payments, including income tax consequences, 
classification of awards as either equity
or liabilities and classification on the statement of cash flows. The new 
standard is effective for the Company beginning
on January 1, 2017. The Company is evaluating the effect that ASU 2016-09 will 
have on its consolidated financial statements
and related disclosures.</font></font></p><span></span>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<div style="display: none;">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_AccountingPoliciesAbstract">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>

<span style="display: none;">v3.5.0.2</span><table class="report" border="0" 
cellspacing="2" id="idp6761728608">
<tr>
<th class="tl" colspan="1" rowspan="2"><div style="width: 200px;"><strong>GOING 
CONCERN<br></strong></div></th>
<th class="th" colspan="1">6 Months Ended</th>
</tr>
<tr><th class="th"><div>Jun. 30, 2016</div></th></tr>
<tr class="re">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-
gaap_OrganizationConsolidationAndPresentationOfFinancialStatementsAbstract', 
window );"><strong>Organization, Consolidation and Presentation of Financial 
Statements [Abstract]</strong></a></td>
<td class="text">&#160;<span></span>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="ro">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-
gaap_SubstantialDoubtAboutGoingConcernTextBlock', window );">GOING 
CONCERN</a></td>
<td class="text"><p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0 0 8pt"><b>NOTE 3 &#150; GOING CONCERN</b></p>
<p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt">The 
accompanying condensed consolidated
financial statements have been prepared on a going concern basis, which 
contemplates the realization of assets and
satisfaction of liabilities in the normal course of business. The Company has 
incurred significant losses from continuing
operations of approximately $2 million for the six months ended June 
30,&#160;2016 and had negative working capital of
approximately $700 thousand at June 30,&#160;2016. Additionally, the Company is 
dependent on a small number of customers in
obtaining its revenue goals. Further, obtaining additional debt and/or equity 
financing to roll-out and scale its planned
principal business operations may be limited due our losses from operations. 
These factors raise substantial doubt about the
Company&#146;s ability to continue as a going concern.</p>
<p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 
8pt">Management&#146;s plans in regard to these matters
consist principally of seeking additional debt and/or equity financing combined 
with restructuring its current debt obligations,
and expected cash flows from our crude oil hauling company and assets that it 
may acquire. There can be no assurance that the
Company&#146;s efforts will be successful. The financial statements do not 
include any adjustments that may result from the outcome
of this uncertainty.&#160;</p><span></span>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<div style="display: none;">

gaap_SubstantialDoubtAboutGoingConcernTextBlock">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);"

<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>The entire disclosure when substantial doubt is raised 
about the ability to continue as a going concern. Includes, but is not limited 
to, principal conditions or events that raised substantial doubt about the 
ability to continue as a going concern, management's evaluation of the 
significance of those conditions or events in relation to the ability to meet 
its obligations, and management's plans that alleviated or are intended to 
mitigate the conditions or events that raise substantial doubt about the ability
to continue as a going concern.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+

<td class="text"><p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 8pt 0"><b>NOTE 4 &#150; PROPERTY AND EQUIPMENT</b></p>
<p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt">The 
amount of capitalized costs related to property
and equipment and the amount of related accumulated depreciation and impairment 
are as follows:</p>

100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">

    <td style="text-align: left; border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double">$</td><td 
style="text-align: right; border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double">3,212,174</td><td 
style="text-align: left">&#160;</td></tr>
</table>
<p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 5.4pt; 
text-indent: -5.4pt"></p>
<p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 8pt 0">The 
drilling rig, in the amount of $398,680 (net
of accumulated depreciation of $66,320) was previously included in property and 
equipment, and has been reclassified to
assets held for sale - discontinued operations, as the Company has ceased all 
drilling operations. During the third quarter
2015, the Company impaired the value of their Treeline Diesel Center, LLC 
subsidiary assets with a carrying value of $224,835
(net of accumulated depreciation of $33,108).</p>
<p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 8pt 0">In 
February the Company exchanged vehicles with
a carrying value of $184,439 for new vehicles with a purchase price of $198,210.
In addition, the vehicles traded were
financed with an outstanding principal balance of $166,614 owed at the date of 
the exchange, which was extinguished in full.
The Company assumed liabilities for the new vehicles of $211,658. Accordingly, 
the Company recorded a loss on the disposition
of the vehicles of $31,272 during the three and six months ended June 30, 
2016.</p>
<p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 8pt 0">The 
company recorded depreciation expense for the six months ended June 30, 2016
and 2015 of $377,255 and $190,410, respectively.</p><span></span>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
